page.title: 14New Village in Cottingham
page.content: My school, Danepark Junior High, made a survey of square number 6 in the block. This is what we found. The area is part of the New Village in Cottingham. Most of the land is covered by nurseries and cultivated land, although there is quite a lot of derelict land.{Plans to use some of {this for a BMX track have been {shelved.}Housing is typical of most old villages but we found some large modern detached houses and older cottages, some over 120 years old, and rows of terraced houses of the early 1920s. There were many semi-detached houses between 10 and 80 years old. The area looks prosperous; many people have their own cars which makes up for the infrequent bus services, one an hour. New Village is poorly endowed with shops, having only five, including a hair fashion shop.
